[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-proptest-helpers/src/value_generator.rs] [Struct: ValueGenerator] [Clone/Copy Traits] ValueGenerator doesn't implement Clone - could this force unnecessary TestRunner recreations in test suites, leading to RNG state resets that reduce test coverage and miss stateful vulnerabilities in Aptos consensus protocols? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-proptest-helpers/src/value_generator.rs] [Function: generate()] [Strategy Rejection] What happens if a Strategy always rejects (returns Err)? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-proptest-helpers/src/value_generator.rs] [Function: generate()] [Empty Strategies] How does generate() handle empty strategies or strategies that cannot produce valid values? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-proptest-helpers/src/value_generator.rs] [Struct: ValueGenerator] [Memory Safety] Does the TestRunner field contain any unsafe code or FFI boundaries? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-proptest-helpers/src/value_generator.rs] [Function: generate()] [Lifetime Issues] The generic Strategy bound uses S::Value with no lifetime constraints - could this lead to dangling references or use-after-free bugs when generating complex nested structures for Aptos state machine tests? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-proptest-helpers/src/value_generator.rs] [Module] [Fuzzing Coverage] For fuzzing Aptos consensus (AptosBFT), Move VM execution, or state storage components, does proptest's strategy-based approach provide adequate code coverage compared to dedicated fuzzing tools like AFL or LibFuzzer that might catch deeper vulnerabilities?
